page.title: 19TOURISM:ASHLEWORTH
page.content: This is a mainly unspoilt rural area with winding lanes,wide verges and pleasant views over the water meadows to the{River Severn}and beyond.In summer motorists take to the lanes in search of a picnic spot,while in autumn they are blackberrying.The main tourist attractions are a fine group of buildings near the river comprising the Church,Court,Manor and the{Tithe {Barn }(the latter owned by the National Trust) and the Boat Inn at Ashleworth Quay,where a{ferry}used to take passengers across the river and barges called in on their way up or down river.Nowadays many small craft tie up at the Quay and their crews use the facilities at the Boat Inn.A few paying guests stay in the village and there is also a cottage which is let to tourists.Sometimes Americans stay at this cottage.
